comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
This is one of the best photographic portraits of Kaiser Wilhelm I've ever seen.

And one of the few bare headed.

comment.author: 82214664@N00
comment._content: You can see the family resemblance to Queen Victoria and her family, that is for sure.

comment.author: 20853770@N00
comment._content: The reason you can't see his left arm is because it was crippled and he was ashamed of that.

comment.author: 41526834@N04
comment._content:
Please, befö:  A mild form of madness was an hereditary chance, and the last(?) Kaiser may have inherited that.
He did not want the Great War.  
He had been kept apart from his parents by Bismarck
Bismarck was an unfit Chancellor - involving the Kaiserreich in alliances that did not work out as planned.  His dismissal was far too late but quit proper, as he was doing the unthinkable:  He was failing to consult his Kaiser on matters of national importance.

comment._content: the last German emporer Wilhem II. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelm_II,_German_Emperor
